page.title: 05FARMING - CROPS
page.content: {BARNTON AND LITTLE LEIGH 03600375} FARMING 4.CROPS - Potatoes.Farms grow, in addition to grass for silage, potatoes and corn.Six of the eight farms surveyed grow early and main crop potatoes.Acreage varies from 44 down to just 5.Successful attempts are made to grow early potatoes to exploit the retail demand for "new potatoes". Cereals:only 3 of the farms visited grow any cereals and these grow wheat, barley and some oats, which are mainly used for winter cattle feed.Brook Farm (Ref.03600375C) grows 65 acres per season, and being the largest producer of cereals in the area, has its own combine harvester.The combine is hired out to other farmers under contract during harvest time.
